channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Markets might be celebrating but every single portfolio manager is trying to figure out how long the roller coaster will last
item.description: With China tariffs increased to 125% but other tariffs on pause, there is a treasure trove of open questions for investors and CEOs to contend with.

item.title: Grandmother Is Stranded When Her Parrot ‘Plucky’ Can’t Board Flight
item.description: Plucky, an African gray parrot, accompanied its owner, Maria Fraterrigo, on a Frontier Airlines flight to Puerto Rico in January. But a gate agent wou...

item.title: Trump Signs Orders Punishing Those Who Opposed His 2020 Election Lies
item.description: The president targeted two officials from his first administration and an elite law firm as part of his campaign for retribution.

item.title: Inside Trump’s Reversal on Tariffs: From ‘Be Cool!’ to ‘Getting Yippy’
item.description: Economic turmoil, particularly a rapid rise in government bond yields, caused President Trump to reverse course on the steep levies.

item.title: Death Toll in Dominican Republic Roof Collapse Hits 113
item.description: The scene at the Jet Set nightclub in Santo Domingo, where the roof collapsed early Tuesday killing at least 124, was increasingly grim as bodies but ...

item.title: The Real ID Deadline Is Coming. Here’s What You Need to Know.
item.description: After years of postponements, the deadline to show a security-enhanced Real ID at airport security checkpoints is now just weeks away. What to know.

item.title: Death Toll in Dominican Republic Roof Collapse Hits 113
item.description: The scene at the Jet Set nightclub in Santo Domingo, where the roof collapsed early Tuesday killing at least 124, was increasingly grim as bodies but ...

item.title: The Trump Envoy Who Got Close to the ‘World’s Coolest Dictator’
item.description: U.S. officials said Ronald Johnson’s actions during his time as ambassador to El Salvador seemed less aligned with U.S. interests and more focused on ...

item.title: Markets Soar After Trump Backs Down on Tariffs
item.description: The S&P 500 rose 9.5 percent after President Trump announced he would pause his “reciprocal” tariffs for 90 days, but economists warned that American ...

item.title: Trump Reverses Course on Global Tariffs, Announcing 90-Day Pause
item.description: The president further raised already steep tariffs on China, saying that Beijing should not have retaliated against his earlier trade actions.

item.title: Canada Will Use Its Retaliatory Tariff Earnings to Aid Workers and Businesses
item.description: But exactly what the country will do remains unclear and the scale of the current disruption makes decision-making difficult.

item.title: Walmart CEO says ‘there will be a Christmas’ despite lingering fears of a trade war
item.description: The retailer has not canceled any orders yet because of the tariff drama.

item.title: AI’s job boom? Not before the bust
item.description: The gap between the AI displacement of jobs and the AI creation of jobs is where the real problem lies.

item.title: Trump didn’t care that the stock market was crashing. Bond yields were the ‘pain point’ that finally got him to pause tariffs
item.description: An alarming spike in 10-year Treasury yields finally persuaded Trump to act on tariffs.

item.title: Why Chipotle won’t raise prices because of tariffs, according to CEO Scott Boatwright
item.description: "I think it's unfair to the consumer to pass those costs off to the consumer, because pricing is permanent," Boatwright told Fortune.
